page.title: 15Playgroup and Youth Club
page.content: There is a group of young mothers in the area who have started a playgroup and joined the National Playgroup Association. They hire the village hall for two aternoons a week and cater for about twenty children. Various functions are held to raise money for equipment for the children whose ages range from2 to 5 years. For the children who live in the more isolated areas the playgroup is a very good chance for them to become used to being with other children before they start school. A Youth Club also uses the village hall one evening a week when there are two sessions, one for the under twelves and the other for teenagers. There are all sorts of indoor activit ies e.g. darts, pool,indoor football, table tennis.
